title: Junior Accountant Job at Star Lanternz Integrated Limited
content:
Star Lanternz Integrated Limited is a financial services firm that offers personal loans, business loans, gadget finance loans, salary advances, and lite loans to individuals and business owners. We are committed to investing in and contributing to the communities we serve by fostering an inclusive environment that promotes financial security and successful careers. To do this, we partner with our clients to understand their problems, discover solutions, and provide exceptional customer service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Accountant

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a team-orientated candidate to fill the position of an accountant at Star Lanternz Integrated Limited, Yaba, Lagos State.
	The accountant will be responsible for preparing the monthly management report, handling tax matters, preparing the budget, and reconciling the bank and receivables accounts.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc Degree Accounting, Finance or other related discipline
	1 - 2 years of relevant experience in roles such as financial reporting, tax and other accounting-related positions
	Strong analytical skills – ability to analyze financial data, identify trends, and support informed decision-making
	Proficiency in budgeting and timely financial reporting
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Solid technical proficiency in accounting software, spreadsheets, and related financial tools.


Salary
N85,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@starlanternz.com using "Accountant" as the subject of the mail.

title: Human Resource Officer Job at ABC Cargo Express
content:
ABC Cargo Express, is a member of the ABC Transport Plc. Group, Nigeria’s leading road transport and logistics company covering cities in Nigeria and West Africa sub-region. For over 26 year, ABC Cargo Express has developed cutting edge, fast, efficient and cost saving parcel delivery services for all categories of businesses and individuals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Scope of Work
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are foremost Logistic Company in Nigeria. In order to maintain leadership position within the top 3 we require the services of HR Officer to join our HR team.

N150,000 - N240,000 / Month.

title: Senior Azure DevOps Engineer Job at IQVIA
content:
IQVIA is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Azure DevOps Engineer

Job ID: R1488097
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	An Azure DevOps Engineer is responsible for managing and automating the infrastructure and deployment processes on Microsoft Azure.
	This role involves working closely with development, operations, and security teams to ensure efficient and secure deployment of applications and services.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipeline automation around GitLab. Maintain and update GitLab runner infrastructure.
	Automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration management using tools like Terraform and Packer.
	Implement and manage containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
	Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to infrastructure, deployment, and performance.
	Monitor and optimize the performance, scalability, and security of Azure environments.
	Collaborate with development and ops teams to ensure streamlined building and deployment of applications.
	Ensure compliance with security best practices and policies.
	Maintain documentation for infrastructure and deployment automation.


Preferred Qualifications


	Azure certifications (e.g., Azure Administrator, Azure DevOps Engineer).
	Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack).
	Knowledge of agile development methodologies.
	Previous experience working in a regulated environment (Healthcare, Life Sciences) preferred


Required Skills and Qualifications:


	Strong experience with Azure services (VMs, AKS, Blob Storage, AppService plans, private endpoints, AGIC, APIM, Databricks, Service Bus).
	Experience developing code in Python.
	Experience with CI/CD tools, GitLab specifically.
	Knowledge of infrastructure as code (IaC) tools (Terraform).
	Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm).
	Understanding of release engineering best practices and patterns. Particularly trunk-based development.
	Experience with repository design best practices for enabling automation.
	Understanding of networking concepts and security best practices.
	Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
	Ability to communicate in English (both spoken and written) required.

title: Administrative Officer Job at United Nigeria Airlines
content:
United Nigeria Airlines is a wholly owned Nigerian company incorporated under the Companies and Allied Matters Act of 1990 at the Corporate Affairs Commission to offer commercial air transportation services under the trade name United Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full time
Reports to: DA & HR.

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	A highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive Administrative Officer to provide comprehensive support to our team.
	The successful candidate will manage office operations, maintain accurate records, handle petty cash, monitor company resources, ensure a smooth working environment, and support HR functions.


Duties/Responsiblities
Procurement and Inventory Management:


	Purchase and maintain adequate stock levels of stationery, office supplies, and other materials.
	Monitor and record usage to ensure optimal levels.
	Maintain and manage petty cash funds according to company policies.
	Keep accurate, up-to-date records of petty cash transactions.
	Maintain vendor relationships and negotiate prices when necessary.
	Ensure timely delivery of ordered items. Petty Cash Management
	Retire petty cash timely to avoid office cash shortages.
	Ensure petty cash is reconciled monthly.


Fuel and Diesel Management:


	Monitor and record diesel and fuel consumption for company equipment.
	Ensure efficient usage and report discrepancies or suspicious activity.
	Maintain fuel consumption records


Asset Management:


	Conduct regular inventory of company property, including furniture, equipment, and supplies.
	Monitor and prevent theft, misuse, or damage.
	Maintain accurate records of company assets.


Issue Escalation:


	Identify operational issues affecting the office.
	Escalate issues to management promptly.
	Follow up on resolutions and provide feedback.


Utility Management:


	Process EEDC electric recharge and ESWAMA payments timely.
	Maintain accurate payment records.
	Ensure uninterrupted utility services.


Office Maintenance:


	Ensure the office environment is clean, organized, and conducive.
	Coordinate maintenance, repairs, and renovations.
	Report maintenance issues to management.


Security Oversight:


	Verify security personnel attendance daily.
	Report security concerns or breaches.


Facilities Management:


	Identify damaged or malfunctioning equipment (lights, ACs, chairs, tables, water dispensers).
	Send repair requests to management or vendors.
	Coordinate new purchases or replacements.


HR Support:


	Assist in sourcing CVs for recruitment.
	File employee documents accurately and maintain confidentiality.
	Carry out any other assignments given by your Line manager


Experience & Qualification


	HND or B. Sc. in any Social Science course or Art
	Minimum 2 years of experience in administrative support.
	Strong organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Knowledge of clerical and administrative procedures and systems, such as filing and record-keeping
	Ability to work independently.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Proactive and solution-oriented.
	Excellent time management.
	Attention to detail.
	Strong interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV detailing their relevant experience and qualifications to: careers@flyunitednigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited
content:
Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited is a leading real estate firm based in Lagos, Nigeria, specializing in property development, investment, and marketing. We are committed to providing top-notch services that connect clients with the best real estate opportunities, ensuring transparency, innovation, and excellence in all our dealings.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



At Yemsays, we pride ourselves on our dynamic team, which works tirelessly to deliver exceptional results. We foster a collaborative and professional work environment where every team member’s input is valued and growth is encouraged. Our services include property sales, real estate investment consultancy, and development projects tailored to meet diverse client needs. As we continue to expand, we are dedicated to empowering our workforce and building a team that shares our vision of transforming lives through real estate.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Graphic Designer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Are you a creative designer who knows how to make visual content pop on social media and in property marketing?
	We’re looking for a Graphic Designer who can bring bold, clean, and engaging real estate visuals to life.
	This role is ideal for someone who knows how to design for conversion, not just aesthetics. If you’re based around Ajah and ready to join a growing brand, read on.


What You’ll Do


	Design high-quality graphics for social media, flyers, banners, ads, presentations, and marketing campaigns
	Collaborate with the marketing and sales team to create on-brand, scroll-stopping content
	Adapt designs for multiple platforms (Instagram, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, Email, etc.)
	Design visual templates for client communication, events, and real estate offers
	Meet design deadlines and stay on top of design trends


Requirements


	Strong proficiency in Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar tools
	Real estate marketing experience is a strong advantage
	Ability to create clean, premium designs that speak to a modern real estate audience
	Understands content for social media growth, engagement, and lead conversion
	Must be creative, detail-oriented, and able to deliver under pressure
	Must live around Ajah, Lekki, or Sangotedo
	Full-time, on-site role only (not freelance/remote).


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month.

What We Offer:


	Consistent design work with creative freedom
	Fun and energetic team environment
	Access to brand assets and templates
	Opportunity to grow your design career in a content-first real estate brand.


Application Closing Date: 10th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV + portfolio (PDF or link) to: emmanueltami7@gmail.com using "Graphic Designer Application – [Your Name]" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Videographer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Are you a creative and highly skilled videographer with an eye for capturing real estate in its best light? Can you shoot, edit, and fly a drone - and you're based around Ajah? This is for you.
	We're looking for a full-time Videographer to join our content-driven real estate marketing team.
	This role goes beyond basic filming - we're after someone who understands how to make properties sell through compelling visuals.


Key Responsibilties


	Capture high-quality videos and photos of properties (interiors, exteriors, lifestyle shots)
	Fly drones to capture aerial views of estates and site locations
	Edit and deliver sharp, engaging, and branded video content for social media, ads, and listings
	Collaborate with the digital and marketing teams on storytelling direction
	Travel to different property locations (within and outside Lagos)
	Maintain and manage video equipment.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess Bachelor's Degree
	2 - 3 years of proven experience as a Videographer (real estate industry is a BIG plus)
	Strong editing skills using tools like Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or CapCut
	Must be able to fly a drone confidently and responsibly
	Excellent eye for composition, lighting, and movement
	Highly creative and flexible - able to work under deadlines and adapt to changing shoot schedules
	Must reside around Ajah, Sangotedo, or Lekki axis
	Open to full-time work (not freelance-based).


What You Get


	Salary: N120,000 - N170,000 monthly.
	Stable full-time role with room to grow
	Opportunities to work on premium properties and exciting projects
	Supportive team and access to digital tools
	A chance to build your portfolio while building the brand.


Application Closing Date: 10th July, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, portfolio links, and a short note explaining why they’re a great fit to: emmanueltami7@gmail.com using the Job Title as the subject of the email (E:g "Videographer Application - Your Name").

 

 

3.) General Manager

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As our General Manager, you will drive the company’s sales growth, team performance, and operational execution, reporting directly to the CEO. This role requires a highly strategic thinker with strong leadership skills, industry experience, and the ability to drive results across all departments.


Key Responsibilties


	Oversee daily operations across departments (sales, marketing, admin, client relations)
	Set and monitor performance KPIs for the entire team
	Provide weekly reports and insights to executive leadership
	Supervise real estate consultants, interns, and marketing officers
	Lead and coordinate strategic property marketing campaigns
	Manage and grow client and partner relationships
	Represent the company at events, client meetings, and site inspections
	Ensure smooth project execution and timely delivery


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Admin, Marketing, Estate Management, or similar (MBA is a plus)
	Proven experience as a General Manager or senior leadership role in real estate marketing
	Strong leadership, sales, and administrative management skills
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and people management skills
	Tech-savvy and comfortable with CRM tools, digital reporting, and collaboration software
	Resides around Ajah, Sangotedo, Abraham Adesanya, or Lekki Axis.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary + performance bonuses
	Supportive leadership and growth opportunities
	Dynamic work culture with a strong digital focus
	The chance to lead and make real impact in a fast-growing real estate firm


Application Closing Date: 23rd June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short cover letter explaining your fit for the role to: yemsaysproperties@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email (E:g "General Manager Application – [Your Name]").
